== Biography ==
The birth of Anne Best was registered in Stockton-on-Tees, County Durham in the last quarter of 1865.  It is not known who her father was.<ref>
'''"FreeBMD GRO Birth Index,"''' database with images, ''FreeBMD'' (https://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=FnjCYR4SLr%2FU%2BjsnZKfGkw&scan=1  : 25-Feb-2024),
Anne Best, 1865, quarter 4, vol. 10a, p. 83, Stockton, County Durham, England,
citing General Register Office, Southport, England.
</ref>  When the 1881 Census was taken on 3 April 1881, she was a 15 year old Farmers Daughter living at Hardwick Field Farm, Darlington Back Lane, Stockton-on-Tees.  Her father is a Butcher and Farmer of 22 acres called [[Callender-692|George Callender]].  Her mother was [[Best-7946|Alice Best]] who had died in 1869 and her father was now married to [[Anderson-83115|Anne Anderson]].<ref>
'''"England and Wales Census, 1881,"''' database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:Q27B-T39F : 12 December 2017),
Anne B Callender in household of George Callender, Norton, Durham, England; from "1881 England, Scotland and Wales Census," database and images, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : n.d.);
citing p. 5, Piece/Folio 4894/109, The National Archives, Kew, Surrey; FHL microfilm 101775358.
</ref>
